text: Hal Patrick Riney (17 July 1932 - 24 March 2008) was an American advertising executive. He was born in Seattle, Washington. He was the founder of Publicis & Hal Riney. Riney was named #30 on the Advertising Age 100 people of the 20th century.Hal Riney profile Advertising Age He was added into the Advertising Hall of Fame in 2001. He was mostly known as for narrating Ronald Reagan's 1984 re-election ads "Morning in America" and "Bear in the Woods". == Personal life == Riney died at age 75 on 24 March 2008 from cancer at his home in San Francisco, California, aged 75.Hal Riney Dead at 75 March 25, 2008 San Francisco Chronicle ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2016 deaths Category:Cancer deaths in San Francisco Category:Businesspeople from Seattle
